titles: The sorrowful lamentation of the pedlars, and petty chapmen, for the hardness of the times, and the decay of trade. To the tune of, My life and my death. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for I. Back, at the Black-boy on London-bridge.,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "The times are grown hard, more harder then stone ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
